body.p: CG Kafka Node listens for new messages on default Kafka broker port 9092. The port can be changed by setting the corresponding node parameter value. Multiple broker endpoints can be configured with node parameter BootstrapServers, so that if one broker happens to fail, the client will switch to another node transparently. Apache Kafka broker also keeps track of the running state of registered consumers to a particular topic. If a consumer is out of contact for a set period of time, the consumer is considered dead and is ejected from the consumer group, triggering a rebalance operation in Kafka. During rebalancing, Kafka assigns the partition of the failed consumer to another alive consumer in the group. Consumer availability check is configured with node parameters ConsumerSessionTimeOut and ConsumerHeartBeatInterval.
